item.title: 美国银行必须面对透支费退款诉讼
item.description: 美国银行必须面对一项诉讼，该诉讼声称美国银行违背了向因 COVID-19 大流行病而面临经济困难的客户退还透支费的承诺。【原文：Bank of America must face a lawsuit claiming it reneged on a promise to refund overdraft fees to customers facing financial hardship because of the COVID-19 pandemic.】

item.title: 独家消息：消息称凯雷酝酿以 100 亿美元出售标准航空
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士透露，私募股权公司凯雷集团（Carlyle Group）正在权衡各种战略选择，包括出售 StandardAero，可能会将这家美国飞机维修服务提供商的价值（包括债务）估价为 100 亿美元左右。【原文：Private equity firm Carlyle Group is weighing strategic options, including a sale, for StandardAero that could value the U.S. aircraft maintenance services provider at about $10 billion, including debt, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 直客销售和成本削减见效，利润预期上调，李维斯大涨
item.description: Levi Strauss & Co 的股价周四大涨 20%，创下两年多来的新高，原因是这家牛仔裤生产商上调了年度利润预期，这主要得益于新任首席执行官的成本削减举措和对直接面向客户（DTC）销售的重视。【原文：Shares of Levi Strauss & Co jumped 20% to a more than two-year high on Thursday as the jeans maker raised its annual profit forecast, powered by new CEO's cost-cutting initiatives and a focus on direct-to-customer (DTC) sales.】

item.title: 英伟达、Alphabet引领 3 月市值大涨
item.description: 受人工智能（AI）热情以及对新产品和扩张计划的期待推动，英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp）和 Alphabet 公司的市值在 3 月份出现了最大涨幅。【原文：Nvidia Corp and Alphabet Inc saw the biggest jump in their market capitalisation in March, driven by artificial intelligence (AI) enthusiasm and anticipation for new products and expansion plans.】

item.title: 独家消息：消息人士称，美国将敦促荷兰对ASML在华芯片制造设备采取更多限制措施
item.description: 两位熟悉内情的人士说，拜登政府计划下周向荷兰施压，阻止其顶级芯片制造设备制造商ASML在中国为一些工具提供服务，因为美国正借助盟友的力量来遏制中国的科技行业。【原文：The Biden administration plans to press the Netherlands next week to stop its top chipmaking equipment maker ASML from servicing some tools in China, two people familiar with the matter said, as the U.S. leans on allies in its bid to hobble Beijing's tech sector.】

item.title: 首席执行官艾格表示，迪士尼将从 6 月起打击密码共享行为
item.description: 迪斯尼公司首席执行官鲍勃-艾格（Bob Iger）周四表示，迪斯尼的流媒体服务将从 6 月开始禁止共享密码，因为这家娱乐集团希望提高用户增长和业务盈利能力。【原文：Walt Disney's streaming service will start cracking down on password-sharing from June, Chief Executive Bob Iger said on Thursday, as the entertainment conglomerate looks to boost subscriber growth and profitability at the business.】

item.title: 解说员：为什么维护 ASML 设备是中美芯片战争的新战线？
item.description: 美国政府呼吁盟国迫使计算机芯片制造设备公司停止维护它们在中国出售的一些工具，这是华盛顿削弱中国生产自己的先进计算机芯片能力的努力之一。【原文：The U.S. government has called on allies to force computer chip manufacturing equipment companies to stop maintaining some of the tools they have sold in China, part of Washington's efforts to undermine China's ability to produce its own advanced computer chips.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，谷歌母公司 Alphabet 正在权衡对 HubSpot 的收购要约
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士透露，谷歌母公司 Alphabet 一直在与其顾问商讨收购在线营销软件公司 HubSpot 的可能性，HubSpot 的市值高达 320 亿美元。【原文：Google parent Alphabet has been talking to its advisers about the possibility of making an offer for HubSpot , an online marketing software company with a market value of $32 billion, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 杰富瑞与日本住友将联盟扩展至加拿大
item.description: 杰富瑞金融公司（Jefferies Financial）将通过扩大与日本三井住友银行（SMBC）的合作，加强其在加拿大的业务，以开拓该国的交易市场。【原文：Jefferies Financial will strengthen its presence in Canada through an expanded partnership with Japan's Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corp (SMBC), as it looks to tap into the dealmaking market in the country.】

item.title: 美国 2 月贸易逆差因进口强劲而扩大
item.description: 美国 2 月份的贸易赤字连续第二个月扩大，原因是出口增长创下历史新高，但进口激增抵消了出口的增长，这表明贸易可能会拖累第一季度的经济增长。【原文：The U.S. trade deficit widened for a second straight month in February as an increase in exports to a record high was offset by surging imports, suggesting trade could be a drag on economic growth in the first quarter.】

item.title: 特斯拉开始在德国生产汽车，今年出口印度 - 消息来源
item.description: 三位了解特斯拉计划的人士告诉路透社，特斯拉已开始在其位于德国的工厂生产右舵汽车，今年晚些时候出口到印度。【原文：Tesla has begun production of right-hand drive cars at its plant in Germany for export to India later this year, three people aware of the company's plans told Reuters, as it moves ahead with a possible entry into the world's third-largest car market.】

item.title: 美国每周申请失业救济人数增幅超过预期
item.description: 随着劳动力市场状况逐步缓解，上周新申请失业救济的美国人数增幅超过预期。【原文：The number of Americans filing new claims for unemployment benefits increased more than expected last week as labor market conditions gradually ease.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称银行业瓶颈导致中俄支付延迟六个月
item.description: 五位熟悉内情的人士说，由于二级制裁的威胁使中国银行不敢为与俄罗斯的贸易提供便利，企业纷纷涌向一家设有中国分行的俄罗斯银行，并面临长达六个月的延误。【原文：As the threat of secondary sanctions deters Chinese banks from facilitating trade with Russia, companies are flocking to the one Russian bank with a Chinese branch and facing up to six months of delays, five people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: Spotify 任命萨博高管 Luiga 为财务总监
item.description: Spotify 周四任命萨博高管 Christian Luiga 为首席财务官，接替今年 3 月离职的保罗-沃格尔（Paul Vogel），后者在这家瑞典音乐流媒体公司工作了约 8 年之久。【原文：Spotify named Saab executive Christian Luiga as its chief financial officer on Thursday, replacing Paul Vogel who left in March after an about eight-year long stint at the Swedish music streaming company.】

item.title: 新的主动管理型 ETF 重点关注日本中小市值股票
item.description: Rayliant Global Advisors 和三井住友 DS Asset Management（SMDAM）周四表示，两家公司推出了首只专门针对日本中小市值股票的主动管理交易所交易基金（ETF）。【原文：Rayliant Global Advisors and Sumitomo Mitsui DS Asset Management (SMDAM) on Thursday launched the first actively managed exchange-traded fund (ETF) to focus specifically on Japanese small- and mid-cap stocks, the companies said.】

item.title: 电动汽车制造商尼古拉第一季度氢能卡车交付量超预期
item.description: 尼古拉公司周四公布的氢燃料电池卡车季度交付量超过预期，这家电动汽车制造商希望摆脱电池驱动卡车的生产。【原文：Nikola on Thursday beat estimates for quarterly deliveries of hydrogen fuel cell trucks as the electric-vehicle maker looks to move away from its battery-powered trucks.】

item.title: 福特将推迟部分北美电动汽车的生产
item.description: 福特汽车公司（Ford Motor Co）周四表示，将把在安大略省奥克维尔（Oakville）组装厂生产的新型三排电动汽车的上市时间从2025年推迟到2027年。【原文：Ford Motor Co said Thursday it is delaying the launch of its new three-row electric vehicles it will build at its assembly complex in Oakville, Ontario to 2027 from 2025.】

item.title: 阿拉斯加航空公司称波音公司向其支付了 1.6 亿美元赔偿金
item.description: 阿拉斯加航空集团（Alaska Air Group）周四表示，波音公司已在第一季度支付了约 1.6 亿美元现金，作为补偿的一部分，以解决航空公司因 737 MAX 9 临时停飞而遭受的财务打击。【原文：Alaska Air Group said on Thursday Boeing has paid about $160 million in cash during the first quarter, as part of compensation to address the financial hit the airline took due to the temporary 737 MAX 9 grounding.】

item.title: 如果与 DS Smith 达成协议，国际纸业将寻求在伦敦上市
item.description: 国际纸业公司（International Paper）周四表示，如果收购英国造纸和包装同行 DS Smith，该公司将寻求在伦敦二次上市，合并后每年至少可节约税前成本 5.14 亿美元。【原文：International Paper said on Thursday it would seek a secondary London listing if it buys British paper and packaging peer DS Smith and the combination could deliver at least $514 million of pre-tax cost savings on an annual basis.】

item.title: 麦当劳以色列特许经营店主将向快餐巨头出售业务
item.description: 麦当劳以色列特许经营店老板 Alonyal 周四表示，将把在该国的业务卖回给这家快餐巨头。【原文：McDonald's Israel franchise owner Alonyal said on Thursday it would sell its operations in the country back to the fast food giant.】

item.title: 被拘留的 Binance 高管因尼日利亚税务和洗钱指控出庭受审
item.description: 全球最大加密货币交易所 Binance 的两名高管之一在尼日利亚被拘留，周四在阿布贾法院出庭，面临逃税和洗钱指控。【原文：One of the two executives from Binance, the world's largest cryptocurrency exchange, detained in Nigeria appeared in an Abuja court on Thursday to face tax evasion and money laundering charges.】

item.title: 康奈格拉品牌公司（Conagra Brands）因需求回升，季度收入超出预期
item.description: 康奈格拉品牌公司（Conagra Brands）周四公布的第三季度营收超过华尔街预期，原因是随着越来越多的消费者希望在家用餐，对其家庭主食和冷冻食品的需求有所恢复，从而使其股价在收盘前上涨了约 5%。【原文：Conagra Brands topped Wall Street estimates for third-quarter revenue on Thursday, as demand for its pantry staples and frozen food items recovered with more consumers looking to eat at home, sending its shares up about 5% before the bell.】

item.title: 美国裁员人数创 14 个月新高，原因是政府和科技公司裁员
item.description: 周四发布的一份报告显示，在科技和政府部门裁员的带动下，3月份美国宣布的裁员人数增长了7%，达到2023年1月以来的最高点，尽管在就业市场依然强劲的情况下，今年迄今宣布的裁员人数比一年前下降了5%。【原文：U.S. layoff announcements rose 7% in March to the highest since January 2023, led by technology and government-sector job eliminations, though cuts announced year to date are down 5% from a year ago amid a still-strong job market, a report out on Thursday showed.】

item.title: 意大利国家担保贷款引发重组难题
item.description: 重组专家说，意大利为帮助企业渡过 COVID-19 大流行病和能源危机而提供了大量贷款担保，事实证明，处理这些担保非常复杂，阻碍了解决一些公司债务问题的努力。【原文：Dealing with the extensive loan guarantees Italy provided to help businesses through the COVID-19 pandemic and energy crisis is proving complex, hampering efforts to fix some companies' debt problems, restructuring experts said.】

item.title: 前外汇外交官山崎表示：如果日元对美元汇率远低于 152，日本可能会进行干预
item.description: 前最高货币外交官山崎达夫（Tatsuo Yamazaki）周四表示，如果日元汇率突破多年来的区间，跌至远低于1美元兑152日元的水平，日本当局很可能会干预货币市场。【原文：Japanese authorities will likely intervene in the currency market if the yen breaks out of a range it has been in for years and falls well below 152 per dollar, former top currency diplomat Tatsuo Yamazaki said on Thursday.】

item.title: 奥地利 RBI 首席执行官表示，Strabag 可能达成的交易无法给出时间安排
item.description: 奥地利莱费森国际银行（Raiffeisen Bank International）是在俄罗斯最大的西方银行，该行首席执行官周四表示，该行无法就其收购奥地利 Strabag 公司股份的有争议交易给出时间表。【原文：Austria's Raiffeisen Bank International , the biggest Western bank in Russia, cannot give a timeframe for its contested deal to purchase a stake in Austria's Strabag that was long held by a now sanctioned Russian tycoon, the bank's chief executive said on Thursday.】

item.title: 近期数据支撑降息希望，期货走高
item.description: 由于最新的经济报告为美联储降息提供了理由，美国股指期货周四上涨，而投资者则在等待更多的数据和决策者的评论，以寻找降息时机的线索。【原文：U.S. stock index futures gained on Thursday as the latest economic report made a case for interest rate cuts by the Federal Reserve, while investors awaited more data and comments from policymakers for clues on the timing.】

item.title: 美国官员称美国未要求印度削减俄罗斯石油采购量
item.description: 一位美国财政部官员周四表示，美国没有要求印度削减俄罗斯的石油进口，因为制裁和七国集团规定的每桶60美元的价格上限的目标是在稳定全球石油供应的同时打击莫斯科的收入。【原文：The United States has not asked India to cut Russian oil imports as the goal of sanctions and the G7-imposed $60 per barrel price cap is to have stable global oil supplies while hitting Moscow's revenue, an American treasury official said on Thursday.】

item.title: 聚焦：美国就业热潮将工厂工人抛在后面
item.description: 丹-艾瑞恩斯（Dan Ariens）的公司因生产鲜艳的橙色吹雪机和割草机而闻名于世，去年夏天，公司因销售下滑而裁员、减少班次，几乎停止了所有招聘活动。公司员工人数减少了 20%，降至 1,600 人，他认为公司业务在 2025 年之前都不会好转。【原文：Dan Ariens laid off workers, cut shifts, and halted nearly all hiring last summer after sales slumped at his company, best known for making bright orange snow blowers and lawnmowers sold around the world. Headcount fell 20% to 1,600 people, and he doesn't see business improving until 2025.】

item.title: 早间竞标关注就业市场
item.description: 美国和全球市场前瞻（作者：Harry Robertson【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets by Harry Robertson】
